Q_DESC:
In the standard version of the math game RING, players begin counting and whenever a player reaches a number that has seven as a digit or is divisible by seven, he says RING instead of the number. Numbers such as seventy require the player to say RING RING: Once because the number contains the digit 7 and once because the number is divisible by 7. However, if one of the two properties holds more than once (for example, the number 771 contains the digit 7 twice) the player only says RING once for each property that holds. 
SRM team is about to participate in the game of RING and the SRM RING team coach requests you to help him in automating this training program by writing a program. Can you please help him out?
